function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Paucity of literature on the mechanisms underlying the relationship between greenspace and health","Impact":"Lack of understanding of the specific mechanisms that contribute to the relationship between greenspace and health, hindering the ability to make informed decisions and interventions.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to hypothesize and test potential mechanisms underlying the relationship between greenspace and health.","Technologies":"Research methodologies, data analysis tools, and experimental techniques for studying the biological and psychological effects of greenspace.","People":"Researchers, public health professionals, urban planners, and policymakers","Owner":"Researchers, academic institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Associations between greenspace and communicable diseases not considered","Impact":"Failure to explore the potential impact of greenspace on the propagation of communicable diseases, leading to a limited understanding of disease transmission and prevention in built environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct research to explore the associations between greenspace and communicable diseases, and integrate this information into public health and urban planning strategies.","Technologies":"Epidemiological studies, disease surveillance tools, GIS mapping, and spatial analysis techniques.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, urban planners, and healthcare professionals","Owner":"Public health organizations, city planning departments, and research institutions"},{"Description":"Failure to consider the impact of greenspace on mental health outcomes","Impact":"Neglect of an important facet of the relationship between greenspace and health, potentially overlooking the psychological benefits and risks associated with greenspace exposure.","Mitigation":"Investigate the associations between greenspace and mental health outcomes to inform mental health interventions and urban design strategies.","Technologies":"Psychological assessment tools, mental health surveys, and environmental psychology research methods.","People":"Mental health professionals, psychologists, community organizations, and policymakers","Owner":"Mental health institutions, community health organizations, and urban planning agencies"}]}
